svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - January 29 2022

title: "Week in Ethereum News
January 29, 2022" date: "2022-01-29"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet execution layer
‚Ä¢ Tim Beiko‚Äôs Core Devs Update . Apps should prepare for PoW switch off by testing on Kintsugi
testnet, EIPs being prioritized for Shanghai upgrade
‚Ä¢ Erigon v2022.01.03 : improved classification of transactions in the pool, experimental issuance
tracking & bug fixes
‚Ä¢ Proposal to charge rollup gas for mainnet to Layer 2 messages
Proof of Stake consensus layer
‚Ä¢ PoS implementers call video . Notes from Ben Edgington : PoW switch off target of June based on
difficulty bomb, focus is on getting switch off right, difficulty bomb can be delayed Kiln (Kintsugi
v2) testnet mid-Feb, Engine API & optimistic sync updates Aim for client releases for public testnets
mid-March
‚Ä¢ PoW switch off target of June based on difficulty bomb, focus is on getting switch off right,
difficulty bomb can be delayed
‚Ä¢ Kiln (Kintsugi v2) testnet mid-Feb, Engine API & optimistic sync updates
‚Ä¢ Aim for client releases for public testnets mid-March
‚Ä¢ Latest What‚Äôs New in Eth2
‚Ä¢ consensus-specs v1.1.9 : update for Engine API, full optimistic sync spec, minor refactors & new
tests
‚Ä¢ Latest Message Driven fork choice Balancing Attack
‚Ä¢ Vitalik: single-slot proposer/builder separation using attesters as distributed availability oracle,
alternative to two-slot PBS
‚Ä¢ Teku v22.1.1 : key management API, avoid timeouts in event stream, sync committee optimizations &
bug fixes
‚Ä¢ Lighthouse v2.1.1 : fix for missed attestations with InsufficientPeers error
‚Ä¢ Eth-wizard v0.8.0 : update clients with a single click
‚Ä¢ Vitalik: paths to single-slot finality (~16 seconds), via super-committees or supporting large
number of attesters
PoW switch off
‚Ä¢ Super majority client with a consensus bug would quickly finalize a broken version of the chain with
no chance to intervene, possibly in 13 minutes, leading to all super majority stakers getting slashed
‚Ä¢ Client diversity : stats & client specific instructions on how to switch
‚Ä¢ Community call #3 , Feb 11, for infrastructure providers & app developers
‚Ä¢ Guide to setup a Kintsugi node with Besu+Teku
EIPs/Standards
‚Ä¢ EIP4721 : Transaction Expiration
Layer2
‚Ä¢ Arbitrum update lowers transaction fees
‚Ä¢ Bybit and MEXC Global adds support for Arbitrum deposits & withdrawals
‚Ä¢ Arbitrum anti-censorship explainer , transactions can be forced to mainnet after 6545 blocks and 24
hour timeout
‚Ä¢ MoonPay adds support for Immutable X ETH purchases with credit cards
‚Ä¢ Polygon Hermez documents their zkEVM opcode-based approach
This newsletter is made possible thanks to NEAR !
NEAR has launched Simple Nightshade sharding to pave the way for greater throughput!
Recently NEAR launched stake farming for apps to work with staking pools to integrate apps‚Äô tokens
into their rewards.¬† The first launch was with Aurora EVM, so you can now stake $NEAR and be paid in
$AURORA.
Learn more about what‚Äôs going on in NEAR in the community-driven NEARweek newsletter.
Stuff for developers
‚Ä¢ Models for token deployment , deploy token root to either mainnet or Layer 2
‚Ä¢ ethereum-cryptography v1.0 : 15x smaller, 5 dependencies; fun details
‚Ä¢ Solidity gas optimizations : use v0.8.4+, calldata function parameters, immutable variables, short
revert strings/custom errors & optimize for loops
‚Ä¢ Minimal constructor bytecode in a tweet
‚Ä¢ ClonesWithImmutableArgs : reduces cost of creation & use by replacing storage loads, proxy appends
arguments to calldata of delegate call
‚Ä¢ EC20Wrapper guide, wrap existing ERC20 to add on-chain governance
‚Ä¢ ZKP Private Airdrop : users provide public commitment to later claim using a zk proof that they
belong in the Merkle tree
‚Ä¢ Twitter Airdrop : extract addresses & ENS from drop address Twitter replies
‚Ä¢ Constant Rate Issuance Sales Protocol : increase/decrease NFT sale price to meet target rate,
collaboration with Justin Roiland (Rick & Morty co-creator)
‚Ä¢ Solidity Metadata Playground : decode metadata hash, view verified contracts on Sourcify/Etherscan,
open in Remix if verified
‚Ä¢ c4udit : simple Solidity analyzer, regular expressions for low severity issues
‚Ä¢ Tenderly Simulator : access any pending transaction with expected outcomes
‚Ä¢ Group signature primitive using zkSNARKs , proof of concept message board where identity of poster
can‚Äôt be narrowed beyond the group
Security
‚Ä¢ OpenSea uncanceled listings used to buy NFTs below market rates, listings valid until canceled by a
transaction, listing cancels are being front run
‚Ä¢ Multichain bridge post mortem , relied on a tokens permit function reverting but WETH doesn‚Äôt have
permit & the fallback function doesn‚Äôt revert
‚Ä¢ Qubit Ethereum BSC Bridge $80 million exploit , insufficient checks allowed withdraw of tokens on
BSC using a 0 ETH deposit with malicious data
‚Ä¢ ZORA fixed price sale vulnerability , seller could increase price & front run purchase, no funds
lost, fix uses explicit buy price
‚Ä¢ Austin Williams: two contracts from BoringSolidity when imported together allow ETH to be drained;
safe contracts may become unsafe when combined
Ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Ethereum.org removed all uses of ETH2 terminology, Ethereum is execution layer + consensus layer,
renaming doesn‚Äôt change Ethereum roadmap
‚Ä¢ Blockscan chat , off-chain instant messaging, Etherscan address view shows unread message count, not
currently end-to-end encrypted, beta
Application layer
‚Ä¢ Aave v3 on testnets (Rinkeby, Arbitrum Rinkeby and Optimism Kovan)
‚Ä¢ Opyn Squeeth crab strategy live, for sideways market (narrow range price fluctuation)
‚Ä¢ Rari Capital Fuse live on Arbitrum
‚Ä¢ Maple Loans v2 , refinancing & liquidation tools for capital efficiency and reduced gas costs
‚Ä¢ Pika Protocol perpetual swap exchange live on Optimism, gradual rollout with increasing cap
‚Ä¢ Syndicate Web3 Investment Clubs , each club can have 99 members, invite-only, can‚Äôt charge carry,
public beta
‚Ä¢ Risk Harbor v2 live on mainnet, includes levered vaults, AMM & risk engine
‚Ä¢ Suggestion to replace USDC blacklist with admin function to freeze balances, save 2100 gas for each
check
‚Ä¢ ZORA v3 : NFT marketplace protocol adds instant royalties, finder‚Äôs fee, non-custodial listings and
fee governance right as an NFT
‚Ä¢ Reservoir : NFT order book protocol
‚Ä¢ MoonPay NFT Checkout supports card purchases
‚Ä¢ OpenSea reversed 50 item limit for their free minting tool after backlash, 80% of items created are
plagiarized works, fake collections or spam
‚Ä¢ ENS voted to set expired name start price premium to $100k to prevent names being snapped up by
bots, premium decays to $0 over 28 days
‚Ä¢ on-chain art : NFT showcase, rated by how data is stored and rendered
Job Listings
‚Ä¢ Re7 Capital ‚Äì a DeFi yield fund ‚Äì is hiring analysts and data engineers
‚Ä¢ Ether Capital is hiring a üë©üèº‚Äçüíª DevOps Engineer üë®üèª‚Äçüíª to stake millions on Eth2
‚Ä¢ Geth team seeks Senior Technical Writer to redo the docs & take ownership
‚Ä¢ Nethermind 1-3 month internship program
‚Ä¢ Are you a p2p networking whiz? EF research hiring Networking Engineer
Reach developers experienced with Ethereum.¬† $600 for four issues (~75 character limit), payable in
ETH/DAI/USDC to abcoathup.eth on mainnet, Arbitrum or Optimism.¬† Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
‚Ä¢ US proposed America COMPETES Act would allow US Treasury to prohibit types of transactions deemed a
money laundering concern without public notice or comment
‚Ä¢ US SEC proposed amendments to Exchange Act expand definition of securities exchange
‚Ä¢ Diem reported to be selling their tech to Silvergate Capital for $200 million
‚Ä¢ Wonderland/Abracadabra/FrogNation CFO found to be QuadrigaCX co-founder Michael Patryn
General
‚Ä¢ Trezor backtracks and removes Address Ownership Proof Protocol
‚Ä¢ Joe Grand hacked Trezor wallet to rescue $2 million in funds
‚Ä¢ Vitalik: soulbound items , limit transferability of NFTs by binding to an ENS name or proof of
humanity, non-transferable items can be private
‚Ä¢ PwnKit: Linux local privilege escalation exploit in polkit‚Äôs pkexec
‚Ä¢ Download of a users Amazon data , includes audio speaking to Alexa
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @evan_van_ness and
@abcoathup to get most of the week‚Äôs news in real time.
Permalink for this week‚Äôs issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-january-29-2022
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new/changes in bold ) :
‚Ä¢ Feb 11 ‚Äì PoW switch off community call
‚Ä¢ Feb 15 - Apr 5 ‚Äì Cryptocurrency Class (virtual)
‚Ä¢ Feb 17 ‚Äì Schelling Point (Denver)
‚Ä¢ Feb 18-20 ‚Äì ETHDenver
‚Ä¢ Feb 23 - Mar 11 ‚Äì Codeless Conduct no-code hackathon (virtual)
‚Ä¢ Mar 11-16 ‚Äì Ethereum Rio
‚Ä¢ Mar 17-18 ‚Äì ETH Austin summit
‚Ä¢ Mar 29-31 ‚Äì ETHDubai
‚Ä¢ Apr 7-9 ‚Äì ETH Portland hackathon
‚Ä¢ Apr 20-21 ‚Äì The Alliance (gaming) summit (Amsterdam)
‚Ä¢ Apr 21 ‚Äì ETHconomics (Amsterdam)
‚Ä¢ Apr 22-24 ‚Äì ETHAmsterdam
‚Ä¢ May 3-8 ‚Äì spaghettETH (Milan)
‚Ä¢ May 20 ‚Äì US Fed CBDC discussion paper feedback deadline
‚Ä¢ Jun 10-12 ‚Äì ETHPrague
‚Ä¢ Jun 16-19 ‚Äì ETH Miami summit & hackathon
‚Ä¢ Jun 20-23 ‚Äì NFT.NYC
‚Ä¢ Jun 24-26 ‚Äì ETHNewYork
‚Ä¢ Jul 8 ‚Äì ETH Seattle summit
‚Ä¢ Jul 19-21 ‚Äì EthCC 5 (Paris)
‚Ä¢ Aug 19-21 ‚Äì ETHMexicoCity
‚Ä¢ Aug 27-28 ‚Äì DeFi Security Summit (Stanford)
‚Ä¢ Aug 29-31 ‚Äì Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford)
‚Ä¢ Nov 4-6 ‚Äì ETHSanFrancisco
‚Ä¢ Dec 2-4 ‚Äì ETHTaipei
